intro: Thamnochortus erectus, commonly known as the African snowbells, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a succulent perennial that belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its fleshy leaves are adapted to store water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Thamnochortus erectus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
